macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Suffer Sharp Sell-Off, Worst Since October
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 2.06%, Nasdaq Composite dropped 2.39%, Dow declined 1.76%, and Russell 2000 lost 1.20% on Tuesday, marking the biggest one-day drop since October with over 70% of stocks declining. Futures are up slightly today amid 'buy the dip' trading.

items.title: Asia-Pacific Indices Rebound Modestly After US Sell-Off
items.summary: Chinese indices rose 0.20-0.40%, Japan's Nikkei 225 led gains up to 1.10%, while moves across other indices stayed in the 0.20-1.10% range following Tuesday's sharp US declines.

items.title: Gold Hits Record High Near $4,880 per Ounce
items.summary: Gold surged 2.50% to a new record around USD 4,880 per ounce, up 13% year-to-date, with much of 2026 bank forecasts already realized in January.

items.title: Trump Heads to Davos Amid Tariff Tensions and Supreme Court Ruling
items.summary: President Trump travels to Davos for speeches and talks with European leaders, potentially easing rhetoric via 'TACO' effect; investors await US Supreme Court decision on tariffs and Greenland tensions.

items.title: Key US Earnings Reports: Johnson & Johnson, Charles Schwab, Prologis
items.summary: Major Q4 earnings today include healthcare giant Johnson & Johnson, brokerage Charles Schwab, and REIT Prologis, alongside regional banks, as markets eye first wave of reports.

items.title: Economic Data: Germany ZEW Improves, UK Labor Mixed, PPI Falls
items.summary: EURUSD surged 0.7% on better German ZEW sentiments; UK showed mixed labor data, Germany PPI fell more than expected; upcoming US ADP employment and Supreme Court tariff ruling.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Declines 2.24% Amid Mixed Trading
items.summary: The global cryptocurrency market cap fell to $3.01 trillion over the past 24 hours, with Bitcoin trading at $89,409 (down 1.80%) and most major cryptocurrencies experiencing losses. Market outperformers included SXT (+46%), D (+25%), and AXS (+18%).

items.title: Record Crypto Liquidations Exceed $1 Billion as 182,000 Traders Get Liquidated
items.summary: Over 182,000 traders were liquidated on January 20, 2026, with combined losses totaling $1.08 billion, primarily from long positions. Bitcoin futures saw $427.06 million in liquidated longs, while Ethereum followed at $374.47 million.

items.title: Delaware Life Insurance Integrates Bitcoin Index into Annuity Products
items.summary: Delaware Life Insurance has integrated a Bitcoin index into its annuity products, marking institutional adoption of cryptocurrency exposure in traditional insurance offerings.

items.title: U.S. Treasury to Include Seized Bitcoin in Digital Asset Reserves
items.summary: The U.S. Treasury announced plans to include seized Bitcoin in its digital asset reserves, signaling increased government recognition of cryptocurrency as a strategic asset.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Gartner Forecasts $2.52 Trillion Global AI Spending in 2026
items.summary: Gartner predicts worldwide AI spending will reach $2.52 trillion in 2026, a 44% increase year-over-year, driven by AI infrastructure investments including a 49% rise in AI-optimized servers.

items.title: Clarivate Names Top 100 Global Innovators 2026, Highlighting AI Leadership
items.summary: Clarivate announced its Top 100 Global Innovators for 2026, with these organizations accounting for 16% of the world's highest-strength AI inventions amid surging AI patent activity.

items.title: Study Reveals Human Brain Processes Language Like AI Models
items.summary: Researchers found that human brain activity when understanding spoken language mirrors the stepwise processing of advanced AI language models, particularly in areas like Broca's area.

items.title: AI Surpasses Average Human Creativity in Large-Scale Study
items.summary: A study comparing 100,000 humans to models like GPT-4 found generative AI now exceeds average human creativity on linguistic tasks, though top human creatives still outperform AI.

items.title: Quantum Machine Learning Advances in Drug Discovery
items.summary: Insilico Medicine research highlights quantum machine learning as a hybrid tool for drug discovery, aiding molecular modeling, optimization, and generative design via noise-tolerant algorithms.

items.title: DeepSeek Sparks Debate on AI Cost Efficiency and Data Sovereignty
items.summary: DeepSeek's low-cost high-performing LLM challenges industry norms, prompting discussions on balancing generative AI efficiency with data sovereignty and supply chain transparency.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Death Stranding Director's Cut Arrives on Xbox Game Pass
items.summary: Hideo Kojima's Death Stranding Director's Cut launched on Xbox Game Pass today across Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S, marking a major addition to the service's January lineup.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Releases Three Major Titles Today
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass adds Death Stranding Director's Cut, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound, and RoadCraft today across console, PC, and cloud platforms.

items.title: Major Game Reveals Announced Throughout January 2026
items.summary: January 2026 has brought numerous major game announcements and first-look trailers, including Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War IV, Code Vein 2, and League of Legends Season 1.

items.title: PlayStation Plus Adds 9 New Games in January 2026
items.summary: PlayStation Plus Extra/Premium subscribers gain access to 9 new games this month, including Resident Evil Village and Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth.

items.title: PlayStation Store Europe Sale Roundup
items.summary: PlayStation Store in Europe is offering discounts on multiple titles including Air Conflicts: Pacific Carriers, Killzone Shadow Fall, and Tomb Raider - Definitive Edition.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Clarivate Reveals Top 100 Global Innovators 2026
items.summary: Samsung Electronics retains its #1 position as global innovator. Six companies earned Top 100 status for the first time (Aptiv, CXMT, GE Vernova, Silicon Motion, Subaru, ZTE), while six others including Apple and LG Display re-entered the rankings.

items.title: Netflix Launches Major App Redesign with Vertical Video Focus
items.summary: Netflix announced a strategic app redesign emphasizing vertical video feeds to boost daily user engagement, building on features tested since May 2025 to compete with social media platforms.

items.title: Bolna Secures $6.3 Million Funding for Voice Orchestration Platform
items.summary: Indian voice orchestration platform Bolna raised $6.3 million from General Catalyst, with 75% of revenue now from self-serve customers, marking growth in conversational software technology.
